title.value: Greg James begins his Gregathlon for Sport Relief

http:\/\/drupal.org\/rest\/relation\/nod.alt: Greg James begins his Gregathlon for Sport Relief

body.value:
Greg James has set off on the first of his five triathlons for BBC Radio 1’s Gregathlon for Sport Relief.

The presenter began his epic challenge in Belfast, where he kicked off the first of his five triathlons, which will see him attempt to run, swim and cycle for five consecutive days, across five UK cities.

Setting off on his challenge, Greg braved the chilly open waters of Belfast Harbour Marina, before attempting to cycle around the city. He will complete his triathlon with a run past Belfast’s iconic sites, which include the old historic shipyard where the Titanic was built and launched, Stormont Castle and Belfast City Hall.

Greg will be attempting to complete over 50 miles and with rain forecast, he faces a soggy start to his challenge.

“I feel like jelly,” he said, before beginning his swim. “I feel really sick but I'm so excited. To quote The Weeknd: ‘I can't feel my face’ - it's so cold.

“This challenge is going to be difficult, but I've trained really hard for this and I can't wait to get going. Seeing everyone's posts on social tags has been really encouraging, so thank you. I'm going to do the best I can, make it entertaining along the way and hopefully raise lots of cash for Sport Relief.”

He also received a good luck message from Coldplay’s Chris Martin and The Saturdays’ Mollie King will be cheering him on towards the end of the day as he aims to cross the finish line to make it to his Radio 1 show at 4pm.

Money raised from the Gregathlon will be spent helping people living unimaginably tough lives, with half of the money raised used to make a difference right here in the UK. The other half is used to transform lives across the world’s poorest communities.

In January Greg travelled to Jordan to meet displaced families living in desperate conditions. He visited a nursery within the Azraq refugee camp and saw how Comic Relief funding is helping to give young children back their childhoods. The money raised through Sport Relief could help more children like these get a vital education, and support their families to maintain a crucial sense of community.

Greg needs your support to keep him going as he takes on his Gregathlon. You can sponsor him here: sportrelief.com/SponsorGreg.

Inspired by Greg? Why not take on your own challenge by signing up to the Sainsbury’s Sport Relief Games which take place from Friday 18th to Sunday 20th March. There are thousands of events across the UK with flagship Games in Belfast, Cardiff, Glasgow, Sheffield, Norwich and London.

Find your nearest event at sportrelief.com and sign up now!
